```{r}
library(dplyr)
source("./SNPs-in-mpileup.R")
```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
SNPs <- read.table("./Data/ST398_specific_SNPs.tab")
pileup_files <- list.files("~/Dropbox/ARTICLES_BY_TDR/2015-staph-metagenome/HMP_PROJECT_SHARED/Mpileup_tongue_dorsum/", full.names = T)
report <- data.frame(Name = character(),Total_bases = integer(),Total_cov = numeric(), ST398_bases = integer(), ST398_cov = numeric())

  for (i in pileup_files) {
  mpu <- read.table(header = T, i)
  r <- regexec("SR.*?_",pileup_files[1])
  SR_name <- regmatches(pileup_files[1],r)
  res <- SNPs_in_mpileup(SNPs,mpu)
  summ_row <- append(SR_name,res)
  report <- rbind(report,summ_row)
}


```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
